'''Venonat''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''コンパン''' ''Kongpang'') is a dual-type {{2t|Bug|Poison}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation I]].

It [[Evolution|evolve]]s into {{p|Venomoth}} starting at [[level]] 31.

==Biology==
[[File:Venonat Radar Eye.png|thumb|left|200px|Venonat using its "Radar Eye" to find {{TRT}}'s truck]]
Venonat has a round body covered in purple fur. Poison oozes from all over its fuzzy body. A pincer-like mouth, stubby forepaws, and a pair of clodhopper feet are visible through its fur. There is also a pair of white antennae sprouting from the top of its head. However, the most prominent feature on its face are its large, red eyes. Venonat's highly developed eyes help it find suitable prey and can shoot powerful beams.

Venonat can be found in dense {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Forest Pokémon|forests}}, where it will sleep in the hole of a tree until nightfall. It sleeps throughout the day because the small insects it feeds on appear only at night. Both Venonat and its prey are attracted to bright lights.
{{left clear}}

==In the anime==
[[File:Conway Venonat.png|220px|thumb|Venonat in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]

===Major appearances===
====[[Tracey's Venonat]]====
[[Tracey Sketchit]] has a Venonat, which he commonly uses to see things at night. It debuted in ''[[EP084|The Lost Lapras]]'' as the first Pokémon used by Tracey, although it was only one of two owned by him before he met {{Ash}}.

====Other====
[[Koga]] and {{an|Aya}} of [[Fuchsia City]] each have a Venonat}that appeared in ''[[EP032|The Ninja Poké-Showdown]]''. Koga's evolved into a Venomoth in the same episode. Aya's Venonat reappeared in ''[[EP176|Ariados, Amigos!]]''.

[[Conway]] temporarily trained a Venonat in ''[[DP088|Camping It Up!]]''. Conway used Venonat in a battle against a {{p|Grimer}} that {{an|Dawn}} was temporarily using. After Grimer used {{m|Poison Gas}} as a [[Counter Shield]], the battle ended in a draw.

A group of Venonat appeared in ''[[DP109|Leading a Stray!]]''.

===Minor appearances===
Venonat debuted in ''[[EP028|Pokémon Fashion Flash]]''.

A Venonat appeared in ''[[EP034|The Kangaskhan Kid]]''.

A Venonat appeared in ''[[EP047|A Chansey Operation]]''.

A Venonat appeared in ''[[M01|Mewtwo Strikes Back]]''.

A {{pkmn|Trainer}}'s Venonat appeared in ''[[EP080|Friends to the End]]'' during the closing ceremonies of the [[Indigo Plateau Conference]].

Multiple [[List of alternately colored Pokémon in the anime#Pink Pokémon|pink]] Venonat resided on the [[Pinkan Island]] in ''[[EP088|In the Pink]]''.

A Venonat was one of the Pokémon seen at the Pokémon Swap Meet in ''[[EP146|Tricks of the Trade]]''.

A Venonat appeared in ''[[EP169|Beauty and the Breeder]]'', where it participated in [[Pokémon Beauty Contest|a Pokémon breeding competition]].

A Venonat was one of the Pokémon living at [[Temacu]]'s father's lab in ''[[EP198|The Heartbreak of Brock]]''.

A Venonat appeared in ''[[M04|Celebi: The Voice of the Forest]]''.

A Venonat was one of the inhabitants of the [[Dragon Holy Land]] in ''[[EP252|Fangs for Nothin']]''.

A Venonat was partnered with two [[Team Rocket]] trainees in ''[[SS012|Training Daze]]''.

A Venonat was used by one of the students of the [[Pokémon Trainers' School]] in ''[[AG015|Gonna Rule The School!]]''.

A Venonat was among the Pokémon seeing during the [[Ever Grande Conference]] in ''[[AG126|Saved by the Beldum]]''.

A Venonat appeared in the opening sequence of ''[[M08|Lucario and the Mystery of Mew]]''.

A Venonat appeared in ''[[AG143|The Saffron Con]]'' as a Pokémon owned by a {{pkmn|Coordinator}} that was taken by Team Rocket.

A Venonat appeared in ''[[DP124|To Thine Own Pokémon Be True!]]''.

A Venonat made a brief appearance in ''[[DP176|Coming Full-Festival Circle!]]''.

A Trainer's Venonat appeared in ''[[M20|I Choose You!]]''.

==In the manga==
[[File:Jessie Ekans EToP.png|thumb|200px|Venonat (left) in the [[Electric Tale of Pikachu]]]]
===In the Electric Tale of Pikachu manga===
Melanie took care of a Venonat in ''[[ET07|Pikachu's Excellent Adventure]]''.

===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
Venonat's first appeared in ''[[PS012|Wake Up—You’re Snorlax!]]'' as a wild Pokémon while {{adv|Red}} partook in a bike race which started in {{rt|11|Kanto}}.

A Trainer also owned a Venonat in which he sent it out along with a bunch of Pokémon to take on {{p|Lugia}} and {{p|Ho-Oh}} in ''[[PS179|The Last Battle XIII]]''.

In ''[[PS332|The Final Battle V]]'', during the [[Trick Master]]'s story of the homeland soil, a Venonat appeared in the flashback when it was one of the Pokémon calmed down by it.

A Trainer's Venonat appeared in ''[[PS421|Clobbering Claydol]]''.

In ''[[PS442|Out-Odding Oddish]]'', a Venonat appeared in the [[Pokéathlon]].

===In the Pokémon Get Da Ze! manga===
A Venonat appeared in ''[[GDZ03|Pokémon Get Match!!]]''.

===In the Pokémon Zensho manga===
A Venonat appeared in ''[[PZ08|Cinnabar Island]]'' where [[Blaine]] yelled at it for sitting on his head.

==Trivia==
<!--

DO NOT ADD TRIVIA ABOUT VENONAT BEING RELATED TO BUTTERFREE.

-->

===Origin===
In spite of Venonat's name it is not similar to a {{wp|gnat}} in size, physiology or behavior, other than on its compound eyes. It is likely also based on a {{wp|mite}}, which also sucks blood, is round, and has a pincer-like mouth.

====Name origin====
Venonat is likely a combination of ''{{wp|venom}}'' and ''{{wp|gnat}}'' (a small insect).

Kongpang is possibly a combination of こんちゅう ''konchū'' (insect) and ''pang'' (the sound that a {{wp|radar}} makes, referring to its radar-like eyes). It could also be a shortening of コンパウンド　アイ ''compound eye'', both referring to its eyes and its {{a|Compound Eyes|Ability}}.
